snippet: The announcement provided some clarity after more than two weeks of confusion over a new law barring adoptions of Russian children by American citizens.
abstract: Pavel A Astakhov, Russia’s federal child rights commissioner, says American citizens in final stages of adopting Russian children will be allowed to take custody and return to  United States, providing some clarity after more than two weeks of confusion over new law banning adoptions by American citizens.
lead_paragraph: The announcement provided some clarity after more than two weeks of confusion over a new law barring adoptions of Russian children by American citizens.

headline.seo: Russia to Let U.S. Adoptions in Last Stages Proceed
headline.main: Russia to Let U.S. Adoptions in Final Stages Go Through
headline.print_headline: Russia to Let U.S. Adoptions in Final Stages Go Through
